articles.description: A day after NPR reported that SF-based healthcare startup One Medical had given COVID vaccines to ineligible patients and non-patient-facing staff, three Bay Area health departments are stopping vaccine allocations to the company.
articles.content: Just a day after NPR reported that SF-based healthcare startup One Medical had given COVID vaccines to ineligible patients, non-patient-facing staff, and friends and family of company leadership, the… [+4866 chars]

articles.author: Kayla Rivas
articles.title: Moderna to reap $18.4B off COVID-19 vaccines in 2021 - Fox Business
articles.description: Massachusetts-based biotech company Moderna on Thursday announced it expects $18.4 billion in product sales in 2021 for its COVID-19 vaccine.
articles.content:
Massachusetts-based biotech company Moderna on Thursday announced it expects $18.4 billion in product sales in 2021 for its COVID-19 vaccine.

articles.title: The smallest business owners are excited and confused by PPP rules as priority window opens - CNBC
articles.description: The mismatched timing of a priority period for the smallest businesses to apply for PPP loans as well as new rules have led to both excitement and confusion.
articles.content:
Sinelia Louis will finally be eligible to apply for a PPP loan due to changes by the Biden administration that allow access for non-citizen small business owners.
